title: 2 men plead not guilty in New York crypto kidnapping and torture case
description: Two crypto investors have pleaded not guilty to charges they kidnapped and tortured an Italian man for his Bitcoin in a Manhattan townhouse. William Duplessie and John Woeltz were ordered held until their next court date on July 15. They were arraigned in Manhattan criminal court Wednesday. Their lawyers had sought their release on $1 million bail. They argued the victim wasn't in distress while in New York and that they had video and photo evidence to prove it. But prosecutors say the two held the accuser captive for 17 days, torturing him until he finally relented and gave them his computer...
